subject: Sexual Health
title: Ovarian Reserve Testing
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ovarian Reserve Testing.

hook.text: A blood test can estimate how many eggs a woman has remaining, giving a snapshot of her ovarian reserve.

buildup.text: Anti-Mullerian hormone, or AMH, is produced by follicles and reflects the remaining egg supply.

discovery.text: An antral follicle count via ultrasound can also estimate reserve by counting visible follicles.

twist.text: AMH measures quantity, not quality. A woman with low AMH can still have healthy eggs and conceive naturally.

climax.text: Ovarian reserve testing helps guide fertility decisions but should not be the sole basis for panic or action.

punchline.text: Quantity and quality are two different stories.
